name: Dum Dama Dum - Day Pass
description: The Theatre and Reading festival by Atta Galatta that began in 2017 unites two beautiful things in a child`s life , the love for drama and reading . The festival will have plays for children from various renowned theatre groups while on another level they can enter into a world of books from their favourite authors and publishers. The Day Pass includes access to all 6 scheduled plays. Adults and children require separate tickets.

address.streetAddress: 178-205, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar II Stage, Hoysala Naga, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: The Silent Chaos
description: In "The Silent Chaos," two clumsy but lovable mimes, Kuku and Madhu, embark on a series of hilarious adventures in a park. They stumble through a series of funny situations, starting with a comical argument over a park bench that ends in a shared tumble to the ground. Their day continues with a chaotic picnic where invisible food turns into an epic, imaginary food fight. Next, they encounter an invisible dog that leads to playful jealousy and laugh-out-loud antics as they take turns pretending to be the dog. Their antics move to a playground where they try to navigate invisible swings and a seesaw, resulting in more slapstick humour. Finally, Kuku and Madhu put on a magic show where every trick goes hilariously wrong, with Kuku trying to saw Madhu in half, resulting in more chaos and laughter. The play concludes with Kuku and Madhu saying a playful goodbye to the audience, ensuring that everyone leaves with a smile on their face. *"The Silent Chaos"* is a fun-filled, full of laughter and visual comedy, perfect for entertaining kids and igniting their imaginations.

address.streetAddress: 178-205, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar II Stage, Hoysala Naga, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: The Thief's Story
description: The thief`s story is about a boy who goes through a transformation from a thief to someone who realizes the value of human relationships and trust. The play has been originally written by Ruskin Bond. It will be performed by Sachin Ravindran and directed by Vivek Vijayakumaran. There will be an activity for all the kids at the end! Once Upon a Time is part of our initiative to bring theatre and performance to children. In this program, children will get to watch a performance created using handpicked stories. The performance will be followed by an activity with the children to help them respond to the story in their own unique ways. The Thief`s Story was developed as part of this initiative at Our Theatre Collective in 2023. Our Theatre Collective is an independent collective creating original multi-lingual plays since 2009. Based out of Bangalore, our focus lies strongly on performance training for actors and theatre-makers. Our studio space in Koramangala, fondly called Our Theatre Studio, has also been hosting curated performances and showcases since 2018 and has recently become home to a variety of theatre-based events for young audiences as well.

address.streetAddress: 178-205, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar II Stage, Hoysala Naga, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo - The Schoolbag!
description: It`s June, and the school season has just begun! After a long summer break, excitement and nervousness fill the air as children in Bengaluru return to school. The hottest summer has given way to rains, soaking new uniforms, bags, and shoes. Children must protect their freshly wrapped books and stationery from the wet weather. As they step into new classrooms and meet new teachers & friends, this play brings relatable tales to life. Join us for "Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo: The Schoolbag!" where imagination takes flight and everything inside a school bag narrates its own enchanting story. Perfect for kids and parents alike, this session celebrates the magical and realistic world of school, making the transition both fun and familiar. Bring your kids along for an evening of fantasy stories rooted in the everyday adventures of school life. Team `Theatre Artistree` proudly presents `Rangaakshara`, a project aimed at utilizing theatre as a dynamic tool to enrich the teaching-learning process for children. At `Rangaakshara`, we are dedicated to exploring relevant themes and crafting original scripts that engage students through interactive theatre experiences. Our productions are the result of extensive research and draw upon the diverse expertise and experiences of our team of theatre practitioners and facilitators.

name: “Pen & Latte 2.0” Writing Workshop by Aparajita Sharma
Drama Shrama – Your Neighbourhood Play Reading Group
The Art Exchange
description: Welcome to The Art Exchange, a social/art event for everyone, hosted by Purnaa! You should come if you are a 1) stick-people drawer 2) occasional painter 3) one of us who doodles-when-bored 4) introvert 5) extrovert It`s curated to combine the two things that make us human: creation and connection. What you`ll get: 1) to create art in a comfortable social environment 2) a piece of art to take home 3) new connections There is no skill expectation. Just show up, have fun creating, and exchange your art (and maybe your numbers). All materials will be provided.
